Knowledge of a mice about the immediate environment of its burrow may help it escape from predator.

question: Which one of the following is correct about the action of apoenzymes and coenzymes?
options: Coenzymes bind with cofactors to form an active enzyme.
Apoenzymes bind with enzymes to give catalytic activity.
Both apoenzymes and coenzymes combine with cofactors to form a non-active enzyme.
Coenzymes bind with enzymes to give catalytic activity.

question: A colour blind daughter can be born when the Options: mother is colour blind and the father is normal., father is colour blind and the mother is normal., mother is carrier and the father is colour blind., father is normal and the mother is carrier.

father is colour blind and the mother is normal.
mother is carrier and the father is colour blind.

genetically and phenotypically identical to the parent plant and to each other.
genotypically identical but phenotypically different from the parent.

options: DNA helicase transports nucleotides that are used to build the new DNA.
the base sequence in the new DNA will be slightly changed from the parent DNA.

options: 20 years before all the symptoms appear in well-nourished people.

Osmoreceptors stimulate pituitary gland to release ADH.

question: The movement of water from the roots up to the top leaves of tall trees is carried out by
units: Grade 10: Food Making and Growth in Plants
options: loss of water by transpiration and its replacement by osmosis.
active transport in the roots and osmosis in the leaves.
the low cohesive and adhesive forces of water in the xylem.

Transferring chemical energy from carbohydrates to ATP
